roleset.name: compare
roleset.note: COMPARE-V NOTES: Based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison to 'match'. Member of VNcls amalgamate-22.2-2. (from compare.01-v)
COMPARISON-N NOTES: Added due to expansion of Nombank. Comparison to 'compare'. VN class amalgamate-22.2-2. Framed by Katie. (from comparison.01-n)

role.descr: second item in comparison, usually prepositional

example.name: comapare-v: common financial usage
example.text: Transamerica said [third-quarter gains were $10.2 million]-1, compared *-1 with $6.4 million in the year earlier.
example.arg: with $6.4 million in the year earlier.

example.name: comapare-v: compare with
example.text: [October sales]-1, compared *trace*-1 with the previous month, ...

example.name: comapare-v: compare to
example.text: [The strength of the US bond market]-1 compared *trace*-1 to its foreign counterparts

example.name: comapare-v: ergative compare with
example.text: This compares with estimates that the US market is 4x as large as my house.
example.arg: with estimates that the US market is 4x as large as my house.

example.name: comapare-v: with locative
example.text: Its price is compared between the futures market and the stock market
example.arg: between the futures market and the stock market

example.name: comparison-n: Be careful with arg 1 and 2. Arg 2 is the benchmark arg 1 is compared to
example.text: In comparison to China, we should say that urbanization in foreign countries developed earlier and is more widespread.

example.name: comparison-n: Arg 1
example.text: After conducting a follow-up comparision of the conditions of these patients,
example.arg: of the conditions of these patients

example.name: comparison-n: Another arg 2 (because the sentance is about TI's notebook, which is compared to compaq)
example.text: Despite the inevitable comparison with compaq, however, Texas Instrument' new notebook won't be a direct competitor.

example.name: comparison-n: Arg 1 (because 'last year's prices' are what this sentence is about)
example.text: Since China's CPI altogether broke through 5% in July of last year, the base of comparison for last year's prices will be significant;y raised, starting from July this year.

roleset.name: able to be compared
roleset.note: COMPARABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WSJ data, compare-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls amalgamate-22.2-2. (from comparable.01-j)

example.name: comparable-j: arg1 with MNR
example.text: These rate indications are n't directly comparable ; lending practices vary widely by location .

example.name: comparable-j: all args
example.text: October Rust is comparable by me to Pink Floyd ? The Dark Side of The Moon;
example.arg: to Pink Floyd - The Dark Side of The Moon

role.descr: first item (or all) that are similar

example.name: Arg1 and Arg2
example.text: The insurance company paid for a rental car comparable to the one damaged in the accident.
example.arg: to the one damaged in the accident
